column2: and steered our course toward the Indies
column3: through the Persian Gulf. At first I was troubled with sea-sickness
column4: but speedily recovered my health. In our voyage we touched at several islands
column5: where we sold or exchanged our goods. One day we were becalmed near a small island
column6: but little elevated above the level of the water
column7: and resembling a green meadow. The captain ordered his sails to be furled
column8: and permitted such persons as were so inclined to land. While we were enjoying ourselves eating and drinking
column9: and recovering from the fatigue of the sea
column10: the island of a sudden trembled and shook us terribly.The trembling of the island was noticed on board ship
column11: and we were called upon to re-embark speedily
column12: lest we should all be lost; for what we took for an island proved to be the back of a sea monster.
